title.narrative: PROGRAMME PLANNING & IMPLEMENTING PARTNERSHIPS

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, public and private entities and civil society demonstrate a shared commitment and increased investments in child rights.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

By July, new CSO partnership agreements established include more sustainable approaches with demonstrated linkages to systems strengthening efforts and a multi-sector focus, Text

target.value: 2021:100% of new CSO agreements include specific strategies to link with local or national government institutions

actual.value: 2021:The sustainability part of the program documents were reviewed diligently and feedbacks and supports were provided to program sections to consider the sustainability, gender and equity parts of the programs. However, not all PDs are linked with government

title.narrative: Status of internal cost-effectiveness analysis of existing NGO partners, Text

target.value: 2021:Analysis conducted and used for decision-making on future PCAs

actual.value: 2021:An assessment/ Value for Money Study has been commissioned and finlaised by an external service provider.

actual.value: 2021:An assessment/ Value for Money Study has been commissioned and finlaised by an external service provider.

title.narrative: Status of guidelines establishing a range of appropriate costs for commonly budgeted items in PCAs to be used as benchmark for TCO, Text

target.value: 2021:Guidelines established and updated on an annual basis by Supply to reflect market conditions

actual.value: 2021:As per new SOP, all PCAs are reviewed by supply before submitting to PRC to ensure supply component is assessed and according to the supply rules. A stanadrd cost for salaries of PCAs has been prepared and used for the review and approval of PCA program
